block.p: Angel Chen, the daughter of Johnny Chen of Manhattan and the late Lydia Zee Chen, was married on Friday to Peter Kitti Usamanont, the son of Vanvisa and Sam Usamanont of Flushing, Queens. The Rev. Pamela Taylor Fogel, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Crest Hollow Country Club in Woodbury, N.Y.

Mrs. Chen-Usamanont, 29, is a merchandise manager at Van Cleef & Arpels, the jeweler in Manhattan. Until June she was an assistant merchandise manager in Manhattan for Tiffany & Company. She graduated from Hunter College. Her father retired as an import-export manager for Sinochem, a chemicals and pharmaceuticals business in Manhattan.

Angel Chen, the daughter of Johnny Chen of Manhattan and the late Lydia Zee Chen, was married on Friday to Peter Kitti Usamanont, the son of Vanvisa and Sam Usamanont of Flushing, Queens. The Rev. Pamela Taylor Fogel, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Crest Hollow Country Club in Woodbury, N.Y.

Mrs. Chen-Usamanont, 29, is a merchandise manager at Van Cleef & Arpels, the jeweler in Manhattan. Until June she was an assistant merchandise manager in Manhattan for Tiffany & Company. She graduated from Hunter College. Her father retired as an import-export manager for Sinochem, a chemicals and pharmaceuticals business in Manhattan.

Mr. Usamanont, 35, is a circulation field representative in Manhattan for Time Out New York magazine. He graduated from Queensborough Community College. His parents own Nicki Gems, a jewelry importing business in Flushing.
